newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Mar 11.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Mar 11.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Former Finance Minister and a senior opposition lawmaker, Saifur Rahman, on Tuesday criticised the government for mishandling with the share market affairs and "mismanagement of the economy".
Demarcation of about 41 kms of Indo-Bangladesh land boundary was yet to completed, said Indian Foreign Affairs Minister I K Gujral.
The former Soviet Union President Mikhail Gorvachev has expressed his desire to start a Grameen Bank type poverty alleviation programme in Russian Federation.

Former President H M Ersahd on Monday said the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) of former Prime Minister Begum Khaleda Zia had forced him to prolong martial law by not taking part in a proposed election in 1984.
Parliament on Monday passed a bill to ammend the Bank Company Act to make it more effective to deal with loan defaulters.
The Election Commission has constituted a four-member Electoral Reforms Commission.
Finance Minister S A M S Kibria on Monday said emotion must be discarded in acting or reacting on national economic issues.

Traders in the kerb market demonstrated on Monday outside the Dhaka bourse demanding withdrawl of a circular asking the listed companies not to effect any transfer of shares without the related transaction sheet.
